ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend this class in order to broaden the perspective .
Political philosophy class using major themes of change throughout history to examine political theory.

History course on modern phenomena. I would not recommend the course if it is larger than 20 students. If it is meant to be a seminar class, then there should be ample space for student participation. And the professor should be able to learn all the students names, not just the most aggressive of the students.
Yes, an no prior history knowledge is required. An evaluation of the most important concepts that shape our world today and a discussion on how to approach them.
This course takes the students through the major historical movements and events that have shaped the current state of global affairs.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I did deepen in some areas, but overall I would say that this course was not directly relevant to me.
History is invaluable for the present - cannot divorce it from policy. Thank you for the course!
Since this course surveyed many historical topics, it exposed some gaps in my knowledge and gave me ideas for what classes I should take in the future to fill those gaps.
